text: The evolutionarily conserved sequence upstream of the human Ig heavy chain S gamma 3 region is an inducible promoter : synergistic activation by <extra_id_0> CD40 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> via cooperative NF-kappa B and <extra_id_0> STAT-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites .
Germline C gamma gene transcription is a crucial event in the process that leads to switch DNA recombination to IgG , but its regulation in the human is poorly understood .

We took advantage of our monoclonal model of germinal center B cell differentiation , IgM+ IgD+ CL-01 cells , to define the role of the <extra_id_0> I gamma 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> evolutionarily conserved sequence ( ECS ) in the germline transcriptional activation of the human <extra_id_0> C gamma 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

text: The <extra_id_0> I gamma 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ECS lies upstream of the major <extra_id_0> I gamma 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription initiation site and displays more than 90 % identity with the corresponding human <extra_id_0> I gamma 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> I gamma 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> I gamma 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regions .

text: These partially overlapping <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responsive elements are functionally cooperative as the disruption of one of them prevents synergistic promoter activation .

Thus , the gamma 3 ECS is an inducible promoter containing cis elements that critically mediate <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - triggered transcriptional activation of the human C gamma 3 gene .
